title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Got an 820-3115 that came in with no power but green light on the charger. Front side of the board looks clean but back side has plenty of pubes, food, and nasty human junk, but I don't see any liquid damage. PP3V42 present, PPBUS_G3H present, but PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 are going crazy. On pins 1 and 2 of U2600 I measure them and PPVRTC fluctuates between 3.3 volts and 3.47 volts and PP3V3_S5 jumps from 0 volts to 3.3 volts. Does this mean that U2600 has issues or could it be something else?

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Oh yeah I should prob add that this is a replacement board has a sharpie mark on top of each coil, port, and anything silver.

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: is P3V3S5_ENTRIP jumping too????

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Actually no on pin 6 of U7200 it's a constant 0.772 volts which I'm guessing is definitely lower than it should be. It's the same on R7272 and Q7221. PP3V3S5_EN_L is not present.

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: SMC_PM_G2_EN present??? What is the exact voltage on  PPBUS_G3H??

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Update: Found some liquid damage it was very hard to see but it was C4617, L4600, and U3311 but none of those have to do with this I would guess?

SMC_PM_G2_EN is present but 0.082 volts

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: So SMC_PM_G2_EN is present.....What about P3V3S5_EN_L....... CHeck after and before R7941....

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Ok so now SMC_PM_G2_EN is present BUT it is power cycling. This has happened to me with PPVRTC_G3H too where I will plug in a known good charger and it will stay constant then after unplugging it once and plugging it back in it will jump between 0 and 3.3.... Pin 1 of 7941 jumps from 0 to 3.3v. Pin 2 of R7941 for P3V3S5_EN_L is 3.4 but also jumping from 0 to 3.4 continuously....

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: TPS51125 is suspect. Also check all rails for shorts.

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Checked each power rail, no short to ground on any of the rails. PP5V_S5 is also pulsing between 3.3 and 4.96, so replace TPS51125 and check back.

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Replaced TPS51125 and still no dice. PP5V_S5, PPVRTC_G3H, and P3V3S5_EN_L all still pulsing between 0 and their appropriate voltages

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Starting to think there's a blown trace or internal short. Idk what the deal might be also noticed on the back of the board for Firewire and the other ports there were components loose and corroded. I wonder if someone messed with this board before or if it was assembled by someone who was careless.

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: PPVRTC should be stable if 3V42 rail is present, so start there. U2600 makes PPVRTC from PP3V42.

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Ok now I have created a bigger problem :/ I tried a new TPS51125 just to be safe, and when I did, somehow the PPBUS_S5_HS pin quite literally burned the trace. I ran a jumper from C7272 to the pad and then properly soldered the U7200 back on and checked each pad. However, now I still have a green light, but PPBUS_G3H is only .23 volts. It is not shorted to ground, but now I have another problem because I made a stupid mistake. Where would I go from here?

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Resistance to GND on PPBUS?

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Well looks like maybe a short now wasn't yesterday. Looks like resistance is 0.4 ohms At best but it does drop to zero.

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Fix the short, probably at that BBQ around the 51125

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Haha I love me some KC barbecue but not on logic boards! I checked the 51125 area and re did the jumper and replaced the chip. I can say I definitely got a lot better at running that wire and soldering that chip lol, but the short is still 0.27 volts. I did notice around the fuse got hot, so I replaced the PPBUS fuse, but still no dice. If I inject voltage how much should I inject? I don't want to kill the board if it isn't already dead.

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Voltage doesn't matter, look at the current draw. At 1 Amp something should start heating up.

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message:
[QUOTE="JohnB8812, post: 27696"]I did notice around the fuse got hot, so I replaced the PPBUS fuse, but still no dice.[/QUOTE]

How could the fuse short the power to ground? Think before you replace :)

Inject Amperage, more voltage will not help heat things up. Best to start at a low voltage like 1V and put the Amperage at 1A and start going up until you feel things starting heating up. Only increase the voltage if you can't inject more amps because the voltage limit is reached
I can not recommend putting the voltage at something high (>1.7V) in case its leaking away into a circuit that requires a lower voltage so you don't blow it up though

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Uhm, you cannot inject Amps, only voltage. The resulting current is the voltage * resistance.....You can only current limit and that just limits the voltage until the desired current is flowing.

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: My bad for the wording, I was trying to refer to the current limit. Thanks for the clarification

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Ok gotcha guys. I have a Siglent supply just need to find good probes to solder on and inject voltage as the probes that came with it are kinda janky. Haven't gotten to do anything with board last few days because slammed with all the boring iPhone iPad and Mac repairs. We need a second tech to do that easy shit so I can focus solely on this stuff :/

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Ok so stripped the wire for the crap probes we got so I could use them to inject voltage. I Solder red to ground black to PPBUS pad for the fuse. I start at one volt and one amp of power and nothing heats up but if I increase voltage it remains constant at 0.79 volts with one amp of power? Does that mean my power supply is messed up or is that bad?

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message:
[QUOTE="JohnB8812, post: 27742"]Ok so stripped the wire for the crap probes we got so I could use them to inject voltage. I Solder red to ground black to PPBUS pad for the fuse. I start at one volt and one amp of power and nothing heats up but if I increase voltage it remains constant at 0.79 volts with one amp of power? Does that mean my power supply is messed up or is that bad?[/QUOTE]

?? Red is usually positive and Black Negative

Did you just inject a negative amount of voltage? Not a lot of chips are going to like that.
How are your wires connected up?

0.79 volt @ 1Amp is alright. Your supply is not malfunctioning given that either your voltage is set at 0.79 OR your current limit is set at 1Amp.
If nothing is heating up you can increase the current limit until something is.

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Ok yeah Smiba you’re right on the power supply I didn’t see the positivie and negative my probes were backwards. I will retry that again tomorrow lmao makes a lot more sense now. I figured it wasn’t the aupply because I can easily inject voltage into iPhones with the battery probes I have for them so that’s why I wondered if maybe I had had bad probes.

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message:
If you have the probes swapped on the supply as well it doesn't matter. They're both the same piece of copper wire.
Just make sure whatever probe is ground on the supply is going to ground on the board.

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Ok gotcha. Will retry that again tomorrow

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: You injected voltage with wrong polarity? I dunno man this board is probably pretty toasted by now :(

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Fuck :( how does the wrong polarity destroy it just curious? Want to avoid doing that ever again even by accident

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message:
Power will flow to the circuit in the wrong direction, polarized capacitors won't like this and a lot of diodes in IC's will mess up and possibly destroy parts of the IC.

Since you applied a current limit and the voltage was not very high you might have some luck but I woudn't be surprised some more things are broken now. Just try and see if we can solve it, this time with the polarity right.

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Ok I understand. With the right polarity, red on PPBUS black on ground, I get zero amp draw no matter what voltage I inject. I think it's probably fucked now :(

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message:
Possibly. Having a total 0 amperage draw sounds unlikely though, are we talking about a low amperage draw (0.01A - 0.1A @ 12V) or just nothing at all?

Green light on the charger?

message:
Doesn't sound too unlogical, the System is in S5 and on a really low voltage so most ICs aren't even working.

The charging light is still there so hope is not all lost.
Just for the sake of clarity, While just running the board from the charger right now. What is the voltage of PPVRTC_G3H, PPBUS_G3H, PP3V3_S5, PP5V_S5?

If you feel like continuing

Voltage of:
P3V42_G3H
PP5V1_CHGR_VDD
PPCHGR_DCIN

title: 820-3115 not turning on, PPVRTC_G3H and PP3V3_S5 jumping around
message: Yeah the customer actually has purchased a new computer from us, so he’s all set. I think I’m gonna use this as a donor (for whatever is still good on it) just because I think you’re right it’s gonna be a nightmare at this point. I appreciate all your guys’s help with this one learned a TON from this board as this is is the first I’ve ever had with no power like that I’ve only had sensor issue Macs, no backlight Macs and easy JTAG removal ones so this was definitely my first true challenge repair. Next time, I’m just gonna have to be a little more careful with a problem like this, but I definitely think this one will help for the long term.
